intro: Phyteuma halleri subsp. nigrum, commonly known as black nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dark seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
